channel.title: Epic recipes?
channel.description:
So I'm moving out to uni next year and I'll be cooking manually, anyone got any epic recipes I could try out?
Preferably simple but delicious stuff, for example fried potato slices... om nom
A 1-10 rating for time, cost, and deliciousness would be useful too.

item.title: Epic recipes?
item.dc:creator: @mago_cash mago cash
item.description:
@mago_cash wrote:

Easy

Get some weiners and cut them on equal pieces, and put spagetthi trough them and boil.

item.title: Epic recipes?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:46, topic:343393”]Ingredients:

  1. Fish
  2. Lemon juice, which can be bought in a container so it’s already done
  3. Paprika (a spice)
  4. Some type of green herb (I’ll get back to you later with the specific name)

Instructions:

  1. Tear one reasonable sized piece of aluminium for each piece of fish you wish to cook – the piece has to be large enough to wrap around the fish securely.
  2. Place the fish on the aluminium, in the centre.
  3. Squirt the lemon juice over the fish generously, but not to the point that it runs excessively.
  4. Tip some paprika on the fish, try to keep it even.
  5. Tip a small amount of the aforementioned herb on the fish, keeping it somewhat even.
  6. Place in the grill (or oven – I prefer the grill myself) for 15 - 20 minutes.
  7. Turn the fish, leave for another 15 - 20 minutes.
  8. Finished – unwrap it, place it on a plate, eat it.

EDIT: I realise it’s a longer meal, at least as far as grill/oven time goes, but you don’t have to babysit it or anything like that.[/quote]
unfortunately ill rarely get to use a proper grill

Read full topic

item.title: Epic recipes?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Ingredients:

  1. Fish
  2. Lemon juice, which can be bought in a container so it’s already done
  3. Paprika (a spice)
  4. Some type of green herb (I’ll get back to you later with the specific name)

Instructions:

  1. Tear one reasonable sized piece of aluminium for each piece of fish you wish to cook – the piece has to be large enough to wrap around the fish securely.
  2. Place the fish on the aluminium, in the centre.
  3. Squirt the lemon juice over the fish generously, but not to the point that it runs excessively.
  4. Tip some paprika on the fish, try to keep it even.
  5. Tip a small amount of the aforementioned herb on the fish, keeping it somewhat even.
  6. Place in the grill (or oven – I prefer the grill myself) for 15 - 20 minutes.
  7. Turn the fish, leave for another 15 - 20 minutes.
  8. Finished – unwrap it, place it on a plate, eat it.

EDIT: I realise it’s a longer meal, at least as far as grill/oven time goes, but you don’t have to babysit it or anything like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Epic recipes?
item.dc:creator: @pko pko
item.description:
@pko wrote:

[quote=“srt8, post:38, topic:343393”]Fried Chicken

What you will need:
chicken breast (cut into strips)
2 eggs
1 sleeve of saltine crackers
salt and pepper

Put the 2 eggs into a bowl and beat thoroughly. In a separate bowl, smash the sleeve of saltines until they are small crumbs. Rinse the chicken, then dip into the egg and immediately roll the chicken in the crackers until completely covered. Place into a pan on the stove (which should be set on medium-high) with oil, and cook until outside is golden brown or the inside on the chicken is white.

This only takes about 15 mins and is MITB’s favorite.[/quote]

I wish I was the owner of this website

Read full topic

item.title: Epic recipes?
item.dc:creator: @srt8 srt8
item.description:
@srt8 wrote:

Fried Chicken

What you will need:
chicken breast (cut into strips)
2 eggs
1 sleeve of saltine crackers
salt and pepper

Put the 2 eggs into a bowl and beat thoroughly. In a separate bowl, smash the sleeve of saltines until they are small crumbs. Rinse the chicken, then dip into the egg and immediately roll the chicken in the crackers until completely covered. Place into a pan on the stove (which should be set on medium-high) with oil, and cook until outside is golden brown or the inside on the chicken is white.

This only takes about 15 mins and is MITB’s favorite.

Read full topic
